title: Multiply equation (3) by $$3$$, then add this new equation to (1), divide by $$2$$ to get $$7x+2y=8$$ (4).
Mutliply (3) by $$7$$, then add (2) and this new equation, you should get $$25x+8y=29$$ (5)

Multiply (4) by $$4$$ and subtract (5) from this new equation and solve for $$x$$. Plug $$x$$ back into (4) and solve for $$y$$. Finally, using $$x$$ and $$y$$, plug back into (3) and solve for $$z$$.
